leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 药物发现-虚拟筛选与对接生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 构象→对接→打分→再打分→验证→工作流
leaf_cluster.tool_form: 对接引擎 + HPC/workflow + 平台

queries: [WEB] deep learning protein ligand docking github
[WEB] structure based drug design tools github

tools.name: ADplugin
tools.one_line_profile: Autodock/Vina plugin for PyMOL visualization and setup
tools.detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin that facilitates the setup and visualization of molecular docking experiments using Autodock and Vina directly within the PyMOL environment.

tools.name: EvoDOCK
tools.one_line_profile: Memetic algorithm for fast all-atom protein-protein docking
tools.detailed_description: A protein-protein docking tool that utilizes a Memetic Algorithm to improve the accuracy and speed of all-atom docking simulations.

tools.name: Jupyter Dock
tools.one_line_profile: Interactive Jupyter notebooks for molecular docking protocols
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Jupyter Notebooks designed to perform molecular docking protocols interactively, including file format conversion, execution, and result analysis.

tools.name: CompassDock
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning-based protein-ligand docking implementation
tools.detailed_description: The official implementation of CompassDock, a method for protein-ligand docking, developed by BIMSB bioinformatics group.

tools.name: PocketVina
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated docking with automated pocket detection
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated protein-ligand docking tool that integrates automated pocket detection and multi-pocket conditioning to explore binding sites efficiently.

tools.name: FlowDock
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric flow matching model for generative docking
tools.detailed_description: A generative protein-ligand docking and affinity prediction model based on geometric flow matching, presented at ISMB 2025.

tools.name: PoseBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking suite for protein-ligand structure prediction
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmarking tool for evaluating protein-ligand structure prediction methods, covering various docking and pose prediction algorithms.

tools.name: rDock
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and versatile open-source molecular docking program
tools.detailed_description: An open-source docking program designed for High Throughput Virtual Screening (HTVS) and binding mode prediction, capable of docking small molecules against proteins and nucleic acids.

tools.name: AlGDock
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular docking with Alchemical Interaction Grids
tools.detailed_description: A molecular docking tool that utilizes Alchemical Interaction Grids to model binding free energies and poses.

tools.name: VortexDock
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed molecular docking system for virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based distributed molecular docking system that supports parallel computation across multiple nodes to improve the efficiency of virtual screening campaigns.

tools.name: PoseX
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark dataset for molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark suite designed for evaluating molecular docking algorithms and pose prediction accuracy.

tools.name: Vina-GPU
tools.one_line_profile: OpenCL implementation of AutoDock Vina for GPU acceleration
tools.detailed_description: A heterogeneous OpenCL implementation of AutoDock Vina designed to accelerate molecular docking simulations using GPU hardware.

tools.name: Vina-GPU-2.0
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated AutoDock Vina and QuickVina on GPUs
tools.detailed_description: The second version of Vina-GPU, accelerating AutoDock Vina and derived methods like QuickVina 2 and QuickVina-W using GPU parallelization.

tools.name: Vina-GPU-2.1
tools.one_line_profile: Improved GPU docking toolkit for virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: An updated version of the Vina-GPU toolkit offering faster speeds and higher accuracy for large-scale virtual screening campaigns.

tools.name: DockM8
tools.one_line_profile: Consensus docking workflow for virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: An all-in-one Structure-Based Virtual Screening (SBVS) workflow that implements consensus docking strategies to improve hit enrichment.

tools.name: GeoDock
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible protein-protein docking with iterative transformer
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model for flexible protein-protein docking that uses a multi-track iterative transformer to predict complex structures.

tools.name: DiffBindFR
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion model for flexible protein-ligand docking
tools.detailed_description: A diffusion model-based method for protein-ligand flexible docking, enabling the exploration of ligand binding poses with receptor flexibility.

tools.name: Vina-CUDA
tools.one_line_profile: CUDA-accelerated AutoDock Vina
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of AutoDock Vina optimized for NVIDIA GPUs using CUDA, providing significant speedups for docking simulations.

tools.name: EquiBind
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric deep learning for binding structure prediction
tools.detailed_description: A geometric deep learning model for fast and direct prediction of receptor-ligand complex structures without heavy sampling.

tools.name: FlowSite
tools.one_line_profile: Flow matching for multi-ligand docking and site design
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of HarmonicFlow and FlowSite for harmonic self-conditioned flow matching, enabling multi-ligand docking and binding site design.

tools.name: DeepVS
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning approach for docking-based virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning framework designed to improve the performance of docking-based virtual screening by learning from protein-ligand complexes.

tools.name: Confidence Bootstrapping
tools.one_line_profile: Confidence bootstrapping procedure for protein-ligand docking
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the Confidence Bootstrapping protocol to enhance the reliability of protein-ligand docking predictions.

tools.name: GetBox-PyMOL-Plugin
tools.one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin to calculate docking boxes for LeDock, AutoDock, and Vina
tools.detailed_description: A PyMOL plugin designed to assist in the preparation of molecular docking simulations by calculating and visualizing the docking box dimensions and coordinates for popular docking engines like LeDock, AutoDock, and AutoDock Vina.

tools.name: DockStream
tools.one_line_profile: Docking wrapper to enhance de novo molecular design workflows
tools.detailed_description: DockStream provides a unified interface to various molecular docking engines, facilitating their integration into de novo molecular design and generative modeling workflows. It abstracts the complexity of different docking backends.

tools.name: MzDOCK
tools.one_line_profile: Automated GUI-based pipeline for molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: MzDOCK is a graphical user interface (GUI) pipeline designed to automate the molecular docking process, making it accessible for users to perform ligand-receptor docking tasks without extensive command-line usage.

tools.name: FlexAID
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible Artificial Intelligence Docking software
tools.detailed_description: FlexAID is a molecular docking program that uses a genetic algorithm for conformational search and allows for receptor flexibility. It is designed to predict the binding pose of small molecules to protein targets.

tools.name: cuEquivariance
tools.one_line_profile: CUDA-accelerated library for equivariant neural networks in science
tools.detailed_description: cuEquivariance is a high-performance mathematical library providing primitives and tensor operations to accelerate equivariant neural networks (e.g., DiffDock, MACE, Allegro) used in molecular modeling and structure prediction.

tools.name: DSDP
tools.one_line_profile: Deep Site and Docking Pose blind docking strategy
tools.detailed_description: DSDP (Deep Site and Docking Pose) is a GPU-accelerated blind docking strategy that integrates deep learning-based binding site prediction with a modified AutoDock Vina-based pose sampling algorithm.

tools.name: DSDPFlex
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible-receptor docking with GPU acceleration
tools.detailed_description: DSDPFlex is an extension of the DSDP docking tool that incorporates receptor flexibility into the docking process, utilizing GPU acceleration to handle the increased computational complexity.

tools.name: qvina
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerated version of AutoDock Vina
tools.detailed_description: QVina (QuickVina) is a fork of AutoDock Vina that provides significant speedups for molecular docking calculations without sacrificing accuracy, optimized for high-throughput virtual screening.

tools.name: FABind
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and Accurate Protein-Ligand Binding prediction
tools.detailed_description: FABind is a deep learning model for predicting protein-ligand binding structures. It optimizes the docking process by jointly modeling the protein-ligand interaction and conformation.

tools.name: gnina-torch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of GNINA scoring function
tools.detailed_description: gnina-torch provides a PyTorch implementation of the CNN-based scoring functions used in GNINA, allowing for easy integration into deep learning workflows and gradient-based optimization.

tools.name: LABODOCK
tools.one_line_profile: Colab-based molecular docking tools
tools.detailed_description: LABODOCK is a collection of Google Colab notebooks and scripts that facilitate running molecular docking simulations (using Vina, etc.) in the cloud, making high-performance docking accessible without local resources.

tools.name: MolecularDocking
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of notebooks and tools for molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: A repository containing Jupyter notebooks and scripts to perform and analyze molecular docking simulations, serving as a lightweight workflow for educational and research purposes.

tools.name: HASTEN
tools.one_line_profile: Machine Learning Boosted Docking for virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: HASTEN is a tool that accelerates structure-based virtual screening by using machine learning to predict docking scores, reducing the number of full docking calculations required.

tools.name: AMDock
tools.one_line_profile: Assisted molecular docking with AutoDock4 and AutoDock Vina
tools.detailed_description: AMDock is a user-friendly tool that facilitates the molecular docking process using AutoDock4 and AutoDock Vina. It provides a graphical interface and helper scripts to streamline preparation, execution, and analysis.

tools.name: AMDock-win
tools.one_line_profile: Windows version of AMDock for assisted molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: The Windows-specific distribution of AMDock, providing the same assisted molecular docking capabilities for AutoDock4 and AutoDock Vina on Windows systems.

tools.name: RNAxplorer
tools.one_line_profile: Tool to explore RNA conformation space
tools.detailed_description: RNAxplorer is a tool from the ViennaRNA group designed to explore RNA conformational space through sampling techniques, aiding in the study of RNA structure and dynamics.

tools.name: CADD-Scripts
tools.one_line_profile: Scripts for virtual screening, cross docking, and protein relaxation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive collection of shell scripts and utilities for automating common Computer-Aided Drug Design (CADD) tasks, including virtual screening, cross-docking, and protein structure preparation using Schrödinger and Rosetta.

tools.name: VinaLC
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel molecular docking program based on AutoDock Vina
tools.detailed_description: VinaLC is a parallelized version of AutoDock Vina developed by LLNL, designed for high-performance computing environments to accelerate large-scale molecular docking campaigns.

tools.name: Physics-aware-Multiplex-GNN
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric deep learning framework for molecular systems
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a physics-aware multiplex Graph Neural Network (GNN) for accurate and efficient geometric deep learning on molecular systems, applicable to property prediction and interaction modeling.

tools.name: PackDock
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion-based side chain packing model for flexible protein-ligand docking
tools.detailed_description: PackDock is a diffusion-based model designed to tackle the challenge of flexible protein-ligand docking by incorporating side chain packing. It aims to predict accurate binding poses by modeling the flexibility of protein side chains during the docking process.

tools.name: FDA
tools.one_line_profile: Folding-Docking-Affinity framework for protein-ligand affinity prediction
tools.detailed_description: FDA (Folding-Docking-Affinity) is a framework that integrates protein folding, molecular docking, and affinity prediction into a unified pipeline. It is designed to predict protein-ligand binding affinities starting from sequence information.

tools.name: DockCoV2
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular docking pipeline for SARS-CoV-2 drug discovery
tools.detailed_description: DockCoV2 is a molecular docking pipeline specifically designed for screening drug databases against SARS-CoV-2 targets. It facilitates the identification of potential therapeutic candidates for COVID-19.

tools.name: REstretto
tools.one_line_profile: Fragment-based protein-ligand docking tool
tools.detailed_description: REstretto (REuse of sub-STRuctures as an Effective Technique for protein-ligand docking TOol) is a virtual screening-oriented docking tool that utilizes fragment reuse techniques to improve docking efficiency and accuracy.

tools.name: QuickBind
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight and interpretable molecular docking model
tools.detailed_description: QuickBind is a molecular docking model designed to be both lightweight and interpretable. It aims to provide efficient binding pose predictions while offering insights into the docking process.

tools.name: dockit
tools.one_line_profile: High-throughput molecular docking pipeline for Vina engines
tools.detailed_description: dockit is a Python-based tool for high-throughput molecular docking. It supports multiple targets and ligands and is designed to work with Vina series docking engines, facilitating large-scale virtual screening campaigns.

tools.name: DiffSBDD
tools.one_line_profile: Euclidean diffusion model for structure-based drug design
tools.detailed_description: DiffSBDD is a Euclidean diffusion model specifically developed for structure-based drug design (SBDD). It generates ligand structures that fit into protein binding pockets, leveraging diffusion processes for molecule generation.

tools.name: SAnDReS
tools.one_line_profile: Statistical analysis environment for docking results and scoring functions
tools.detailed_description: SAnDReS (Statistical Analysis of Docking Results and Scoring functions) is a computational environment for developing and analyzing machine-learning models to predict ligand-binding affinity. It provides tools for statistical analysis of docking outcomes.

tools.name: PLACER
tools.one_line_profile: Graph neural network for protein-ligand conformational ensemble prediction
tools.detailed_description: PLACER is a graph neural network-based tool for predicting local protein-ligand conformational ensembles. It aids in understanding the flexibility and dynamic interactions within protein-ligand complexes.

tools.name: metascreener
tools.one_line_profile: Integration script collection for docking and virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: metascreener is a collection of scripts designed to integrate various docking, virtual screening, similarity search, and molecular modeling programs into a cohesive workflow for drug discovery.

tools.name: watvina
tools.one_line_profile: AutoDock Vina fork with explicit/implicit water models
tools.detailed_description: watvina is a modified version of the AutoDock Vina engine that incorporates implicit or explicit water models to improve docking accuracy. It also supports pharmacophore and position-constrained docking.

tools.name: Scalar Fields
tools.one_line_profile: Equivariant scalar fields for molecular docking with FFT
tools.detailed_description: This tool implements Equivariant Scalar Fields for molecular docking, utilizing Fast Fourier Transforms (FFT) to accelerate the docking process while maintaining equivariance properties.

tools.name: Animal-in-Motion
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for animal video data processing and pose prediction
tools.detailed_description: Animal-in-Motion is a data collection and processing pipeline for animal videos. It includes annotations for masks, keypoints, depth, and occlusion, suitable for 3D/4D reconstruction, tracking, and pose prediction in biological research.

tools.name: Protenix-Dock
tools.one_line_profile: End-to-end trainable protein-ligand docking framework
tools.detailed_description: Protenix-Dock is an accurate and trainable end-to-end framework for protein-ligand docking. It leverages deep learning to predict binding poses directly.

tools.name: CarsiDock
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning paradigm for accurate protein-ligand docking
tools.detailed_description: CarsiDock is a deep learning-based tool for accurate protein-ligand docking and screening. It utilizes large-scale pre-training to improve prediction performance.

tools.name: AutoDock Vina
tools.one_line_profile: Standard open-source molecular docking engine
tools.detailed_description: AutoDock Vina is one of the most widely used open-source programs for molecular docking. It significantly improves the average accuracy of the binding mode predictions compared to AutoDock 4.

tools.name: ProLIF
tools.one_line_profile: Interaction fingerprints generator for protein-ligand complexes
tools.detailed_description: ProLIF is a library designed to generate Interaction Fingerprints (IFP) for protein-ligand complexes. It supports analysis of molecular dynamics trajectories and docking poses to characterize binding interactions.

tools.name: CReM-dock
tools.one_line_profile: Docking-guided chemical generation tool
tools.detailed_description: CReM-dock is a tool for generating chemically reasonable molecules guided by molecular docking scores. It combines chemical generation with structure-based evaluation.

tools.name: DeepDock
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning package for molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: DeepDock is an experimental package from DeepChem that applies deep learning techniques to molecular docking tasks, aiming to improve prediction accuracy over traditional methods.

tools.name: dockstring
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for molecular docking with curated datasets and benchmarking capabilities
tools.detailed_description: dockstring is a Python package that facilitates molecular docking tasks by providing a simple interface to the AutoDock Vina engine, coupled with a highly curated dataset for benchmarking and regression tasks in drug discovery.

tools.name: Uni-Dock
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated molecular docking program
tools.detailed_description: Uni-Dock is a high-performance, GPU-accelerated molecular docking software developed by DP Technology. It is designed to speed up the virtual screening process significantly compared to traditional CPU-based methods.

tools.name: Uni-Dock2
tools.one_line_profile: Next-generation GPU-accelerated molecular docking software
tools.detailed_description: Uni-Dock 2 is the successor to Uni-Dock, offering enhanced performance and features for GPU-accelerated molecular docking in drug discovery pipelines.

tools.name: LigGrep
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for filtering docked poses based on receptor-ligand interactions
tools.detailed_description: LigGrep is a command-line tool designed to analyze and filter molecular docking results. It identifies docked poses that participate in specific user-defined receptor-ligand interactions, aiding in the selection of promising candidates.

tools.name: MolModa
tools.one_line_profile: Browser-based molecular docking environment
tools.detailed_description: MolModa is a web-based platform that allows users to perform molecular docking entirely within their web browser, leveraging WebAssembly technologies to run docking engines locally.

tools.name: Webina
tools.one_line_profile: JavaScript/WebAssembly library for running AutoDock Vina in the browser
tools.detailed_description: Webina is a library that ports AutoDock Vina to WebAssembly, enabling molecular docking calculations to run directly in a web browser on the client side.

tools.name: Ringtail
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and storage package for virtual screenings with AutoDock
tools.detailed_description: Ringtail is a Python package developed by the Forli Lab for managing, storing, and analyzing large-scale virtual screening results generated by AutoDock-GPU and AutoDock Vina.

tools.name: DiffDock
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion generative model for molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: DiffDock is a state-of-the-art deep learning framework that uses diffusion generative models to predict the 3D structure of protein-ligand complexes (molecular docking) with high accuracy.

tools.name: DisCo-DiffDock
tools.one_line_profile: Enhanced diffusion model for molecular docking with discrete latents
tools.detailed_description: DisCo-DiffDock is an extension of the DiffDock model that incorporates discrete latents to enhance the continuous diffusion process for molecular docking tasks.

tools.name: GNINA
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning framework for molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: GNINA is a molecular docking software that utilizes deep convolutional neural networks to score protein-ligand poses, providing an alternative to traditional empirical scoring functions.

tools.name: Phinder
tools.one_line_profile: Pharmacophore feature identification using GNINA
tools.detailed_description: Phinder is a tool for the semi-automatic identification of pharmacophore features from unbound receptor structures using GNINA fragment docking.

tools.name: POAP
tools.one_line_profile: Parallelized Open Babel & Autodock suite Pipeline
tools.detailed_description: POAP is a pipeline tool designed to parallelize ligand preparation (using Open Babel) and molecular docking (using AutoDock suite) to facilitate high-throughput virtual screening.

tools.name: DrugHIVE
tools.one_line_profile: Deep hierarchical generative model for structure-based drug design
tools.detailed_description: DrugHIVE is a deep generative model designed for structure-based drug design (SBDD). It utilizes a hierarchical approach to generate small molecule structures that fit within specific protein binding pockets.

tools.name: IDPConformerGenerator
tools.one_line_profile: Conformational sampling tool for Intrinsically Disordered Proteins
tools.detailed_description: A tool developed by the Forman-Kay Lab to build conformational representations of Intrinsically Disordered Proteins (IDPs) and Regions (IDRs) through guided sampling of protein torsion space.

tools.name: autoparty
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning-guided visual inspection tool for molecular docking
tools.detailed_description: Autoparty is a tool from Keiser Lab that assists in the visual inspection of molecular docking results using machine learning guidance, helping to prioritize poses for manual review.

tools.name: DiffDock-PP
tools.one_line_profile: Rigid Protein-Protein Docking using Diffusion Models
tools.detailed_description: DiffDock-PP is a deep learning method for rigid protein-protein docking that leverages diffusion models to predict the docked complex structure.

tools.name: LightDock
tools.one_line_profile: Macromolecular docking framework based on the Glowworm Swarm Optimization algorithm
tools.detailed_description: LightDock is a protein-protein, protein-peptide, and protein-DNA docking framework that uses the Glowworm Swarm Optimization (GSO) algorithm. It supports flexible docking and is highly scalable.

tools.name: LightDock (Python 2.7)
tools.one_line_profile: Legacy Python 2.7 version of the LightDock docking framework
tools.detailed_description: This is the legacy Python 2.7 implementation of the LightDock macromolecular docking framework. While the main version has moved to Python 3, this repo is maintained for compatibility or reference.

tools.name: LightDock-Rust
tools.one_line_profile: Rust implementation of the LightDock docking software
tools.detailed_description: A Rust port of the LightDock macromolecular docking software, aiming for performance improvements and memory safety provided by the Rust language.

tools.name: Dockey
tools.one_line_profile: Integrated workflow tool for molecular docking and virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: Dockey is an integrated tool designed to streamline molecular docking and virtual screening workflows. It automates ligand preparation, docking execution, and result analysis.

tools.name: Str2Str
tools.one_line_profile: Score-based framework for zero-shot protein conformation sampling
tools.detailed_description: Str2Str is a score-based generative framework for sampling protein conformations in a zero-shot manner, enabling the exploration of protein structural diversity without extensive training on specific targets.

tools.name: 3D-Generative-SBDD
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Generative Model for Structure-Based Drug Design
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model for generating 3D molecular structures conditioned on protein binding sites, designed for structure-based drug design applications.

tools.name: TankBind
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning model for protein-ligand binding structure prediction
tools.detailed_description: TankBind is a deep learning model that predicts protein-ligand binding structures and affinities. It treats the binding pocket as a 'tank' to capture interactions.

tools.name: Plantain
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular docking tool with AI-based pose scoring function
tools.detailed_description: Plantain is a molecular docking tool that integrates an artificial intelligence-based scoring function to improve the accuracy of pose prediction and virtual screening.

tools.name: EquiDock
tools.one_line_profile: Geometric deep learning model for fast rigid 3D protein-protein docking
tools.detailed_description: An SE(3)-equivariant geometric deep learning model designed to predict the complex structure of two proteins by performing rigid body docking.

tools.name: Boltzina
tools.one_line_profile: Docking-guided binding prediction tool for virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: A virtual screening tool that combines docking with deep learning-based binding prediction (Boltz-2) to achieve efficient and accurate identification of active compounds.

tools.name: DockingPie
tools.one_line_profile: PyMOL plugin for consensus docking and result analysis
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for PyMOL that integrates various docking programs (Vina, RxDock, etc.) to perform consensus docking and analyze binding modes within a graphical interface.

tools.name: ab_opt
tools.one_line_profile: Generative diffusion models for antibody design and docking
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of generative diffusion models specifically tailored for the design, docking, and optimization of antibodies.

tools.name: DiffDock-Pocket
tools.one_line_profile: Diffusion model for pocket-level docking with side chain flexibility
tools.detailed_description: An extension of DiffDock that focuses on pocket-level docking and incorporates side chain flexibility for more accurate protein-ligand binding predictions.

tools.name: runs-n-poses
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark dataset for protein-ligand co-folding prediction
tools.detailed_description: A curated benchmark dataset designed to evaluate models for protein-ligand co-folding and interaction prediction.

tools.name: PandaDock
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-based molecular docking tool
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based molecular docking tool that utilizes physics-based scoring functions to predict ligand binding poses.

tools.name: PyPLIF-HIPPOS
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular interaction fingerprinting tool for docking results
tools.detailed_description: A tool for generating protein-ligand interaction fingerprints (PLIF) from docking results produced by AutoDock Vina and PLANTS, facilitating post-docking analysis.

tools.name: screenlamp
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for hypothesis-driven virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: A Python toolkit designed to facilitate hypothesis-driven virtual screening workflows, allowing for customized filtering and selection of ligand candidates.

tools.name: siteinterlock
tools.one_line_profile: Graph-based pose selection for protein-ligand docking
tools.detailed_description: A tool that applies graph theory to improve pose selection in protein-ligand docking, aiming to identify the most probable binding conformations.

tools.name: P2Rank
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning-based ligand binding site prediction tool
tools.detailed_description: A standalone command-line tool that predicts ligand binding sites from protein structures using machine learning algorithms.

tools.name: FABFlex
tools.one_line_profile: Fast and accurate blind flexible docking model
tools.detailed_description: Official implementation of the ICLR 2025 paper 'Fast and Accurate Blind Flexible Docking', providing a deep learning model for flexible protein-ligand docking.

tools.name: dockECR
tools.one_line_profile: Consensus docking and ranking protocol for virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: An open protocol for consensus docking and ranking of small molecules, designed to improve the reliability of virtual screening campaigns.

tools.name: gdock
tools.one_line_profile: Genetic algorithm-based protein-protein docking tool
tools.detailed_description: A protein-protein docking application implemented in Rust that utilizes genetic algorithms for conformational search.

tools.name: docking_py
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for automating molecular docking with Vina/Smina
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that simplifies the automation and scripting of molecular docking tasks using Smina, Vina, and their variants.

tools.name: VSDS-VD
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmarking framework for AI-powered docking methods in virtual screening
tools.detailed_description: A repository for benchmarking AI-powered docking methods specifically from the perspective of virtual screening, providing datasets and evaluation scripts.

tools.name: Auto_AutoDock-GPU
tools.one_line_profile: Batch processing tools for high-throughput protein-ligand docking with AutoDock-GPU
tools.detailed_description: A set of tools designed to facilitate high-throughput protein-ligand docking in batch mode utilizing the AutoDock-GPU engine.

tools.name: AutoDock VinaXB
tools.one_line_profile: AutoDock Vina variant with halogen bond scoring function (XBSF)
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of XBSF, a new empirical halogen bond scoring function, integrated into AutoDock Vina to improve docking accuracy for halogenated ligands.

tools.name: VS-autodock-vina
tools.one_line_profile: AutoDock Vina extension for virtual screening analysis
tools.detailed_description: A modified version of AutoDock Vina that adds functionality specifically for analyzing virtual screening results.

tools.name: mvina
tools.one_line_profile: Modified version of AutoDock Vina for Linux
tools.detailed_description: A modified implementation of the AutoDock Vina docking engine, optimized for Linux environments.

tools.name: VinaSH
tools.one_line_profile: AutoDock Vina variant accounting for Sigma Hole interactions
tools.detailed_description: An improved version of AutoDock Vina that incorporates Sigma Hole interactions into the scoring function for better docking accuracy.

tools.name: DiffDock (Colab)
tools.one_line_profile: Colab implementation of the DiffDock molecular docking model
tools.detailed_description: A Jupyter Notebook/Colab implementation of DiffDock, a diffusion generative model for molecular docking, enabling researchers to run the tool in cloud environments.

tools.name: FlexPose
tools.one_line_profile: AI-based framework for flexible protein-ligand binding pose modeling
tools.detailed_description: A framework for AI-based flexible modeling of protein-ligand binding poses, addressing the flexibility of both ligand and protein during docking.

tools.name: FlexDock
tools.one_line_profile: Flexible docking and relaxation using composed unbalanced flows
tools.detailed_description: Implementation of a method for flexible docking and relaxation by composing unbalanced flows, as presented at ICLR 2025.

tools.name: ProQDock
tools.one_line_profile: Support Vector Regression based protein-protein docking scoring program
tools.detailed_description: A scoring program for protein-protein docking that uses high-level coordinate-driven features and a Support Vector Regression algorithm to evaluate docking models.

tools.name: FeatureDock
tools.one_line_profile: Transformer-based protein-ligand docking software
tools.detailed_description: A protein-ligand docking software guided by physicochemical feature-based local environment learning using Transformer architecture.

tools.name: IGModel
tools.one_line_profile: Simultaneous prediction of ligand docking pose RMSD and binding strength
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning model capable of simultaneously predicting the RMSD of a ligand docking pose and its binding strength against the target protein.

tools.name: OnionNet-SFCT
tools.one_line_profile: Scoring function correction term for protein-ligand docking
tools.detailed_description: A tool to improve protein-ligand docking and screening accuracies by incorporating a scoring function correction term (SFCT) based on the OnionNet architecture.
